text: thumb | right|220px |Max van Weezel in 1979 Max Hans van Weezel (9 July 1951 – 11 April 2019) was a Dutch journalist and politician. He was born in Amsterdam, Netherlands. He was also a political writer and commentator for the Vrij Nederland. Between 1973 and 1976, he was a member of CPN and along with his wife journalist Anet Bleich, he released the book Ga dan zelf naar Siberië! (1978). In 1976 he started as a journalist at Vrij Nederland. Were he wrote the column 'Het Wereldje'. Van Weezel died on 11 April 2019, in Amsterdam from pancreatic cancer at the age of 67. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Dutch Jews Category:Dutch journalists Category:Jewish writers Category:Political commentators Category:Writers from Amsterdam
title: Max van Weezel
